text: _Team *Prospela Students (beta)* joined the shared channel_
_Team *Prospela Mentors (beta)* joined the shared channel_
_@mattcoleman1995 has joined the channel_
_@benjohnstonvfx has joined the channel_

Hey Matt, please meet Ben your incredible E-Mentor I've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:
_@dexter has left the channel_
_@dexter has left the channel_
Hey Matt!
Hey Ben!

Sorry for the late reply (late tea!)

Just wanted to say thanks for taking the time to help me with advice and guidance, it means a lot :+1:

Hey dude! No worries! I just finished mine too ngl :wink:
And don't worry about it at all, when I was getting started I blindly posted on reddit and got talking to a guy who was working in London and he gave me loads of help and advice. Having that insight from the industry was a god send when I got to applying for jobs and doing my showreel and stuff. I know the industry can seem super intimidating so any question you have just shout!
I guess I'll start by saying a bit about myself and my career so far? (this is the first time I have done something like this so bear with me :P)
Thanks for sharing about that, I've been trying to get in touch with a few people through LinkedIn... Not much luck so far with replies :joy: but never thought of using reddit for it!!
Yeah man I just put something up and got a couple of responses and one of them was a comper at DNEG!
I always find Linkedin is a bit hit and miss with getting people to reply :stuck_out_tongue:

& yeah no worries! My first time too :grin:
Oh real nice, if you don't mind me asking, is that how you got your foot in the door kind of thing at DNEG? 
When I seen you was there I was like wow oh my god, that's awesome :grin:

So right now I am a Roto & Prep Lead at DNEGTV. I started out at DNEG as a runner just under 3 years ago. I then moved up to work as a tech checker in DNEGTV about 2 years ago and I ahve been doing shot work ever since!
So yeah I started out as an artist runner
Being a runner wasn't very glamorous I'm not going to lie to you
But it was a really good opportunity to get used to the place a bit and learn how DNEG does stuff

I also found it was good for me because I was a pretty nervous person back then and it helped for me to see that it wasn't a big scary thing and that most people in the industry are really nice and willing to talk about what they are working on and how they are doing it and stuff

That's real cool. So your roto skills are pretty good then I'm guessing :laughing: something I'm really trying to work on at the moment because we ain't got a big enough green screen for some footage I filmed so my head's kind of just above the green screen :joy:
As a runner, what do you actually do? In my head I see it as brewing up and doing literally any task anyone needs at any time, but I could be completely wrong!

Yeah dude roto is a dark art honestly. You pick up so many tricks by just doing shots and seeing what works and what doesn't tbh. I can talk you through the finer technical points of it at a later time if you like?
(One of my supes literally wrote an entire book about roto :P)

That's good to hear that you used to be quite nervous and it's helped get you over that. I think I'm probably quite similar to that right now, quite nervous hate speaking Infront of groups.. so trying to work on that by doing presentations whenever I can even though at the time I just wanna run and hide if you get me :joy:
Okay, I would really appreciate that tbh! What's the book I'll take a look!
Oh yeah totally, like when I was applying for the job I knew that it would be a good way to test the waters a bit and see if I liked the company.
With the
whoops ignore that :stuck_out_tongue:

Doing the presentations are a really good way to sort of push yourself out of your comfort zone a bit too. When I was finishing uni I ended up 'hosting' the end of year show which involved standing on stage infront of a cinema full of people (bloody terrifying) but that taught me that I could do it if I prepared enough and that helped me loads in the long term
but its totaly normal to not want to do it all the time too

Also another thing I have found is that being able to explain what you are doing on a shot, be that a technique in Nuke or Houdini or whatever, is a really good way to help understand what you are actually doing, if that makes sense.
So yeah as a runner
Mostly you are just doing odd jobs that need doing in the office
so that could be going around and washing the dishes in the kitchens
or sitting on the post desk and signing for parcels that are ordered to work
or you could be running hard drives of footage and assets and stuff betwwen the studio and other post and editing houses
I remember one night I had to run the stereo version of Beauty and the Beast from work to an edit place in Soho on 2 massive drives
but yeah its mostly just odd jobs really

Oh okay! Makes sense I guess. Will keep my eye open for anything similar in Manchester while I'm here for uni. 
Jeese, that's huge. Congrats on even attempting the hosting :facepunch:

I think I understand, like if I were to be doing a technique in nuke I should be able to fully describe what it is I'm doing and why?

Oh okay, that sounds weirdly satisfying, obviously not the dishes, but the idea of just doing literally anything that's needed so your pretty much helping the whole team.

Yeah dude I was bricking it but it was good to prove to myself that I could do it if that makes sense?
And yeah kind of, we have had a couple of juniors start in our department and I have been explaining techniques to them and in doing that I have learned it a bit better, if that makes sense. And yeah there are loads of people in the industry who started out as runners so people will actively come up to you and ask how you are doing and what you are into etc if they see you are doing runner tasks

And dude I am not gonna lie, I am probs gonna be heading off to bed soon. Feel free to drop some questions in here whenever and I will answer as soon as I can. I get the bus to work from 8-9amish and usually take lunch between 1-2pmish but will try and reply whenever I can!
Also don't feel like there are any silly questions, I know how it feels to be in this position and honestly asking is much better than assuming and finding out you thought wrong too late

Yeah that 100% makes sense it's what I'm trying to do now just speaking presentations and at induction evenings for newer students to say what we do and that.

Yeah I hear ya, I'll try to make sure when I am learning that I do go into detail or even explain to someone else :+1: thanks for that advice.

Yeah man don't feel the need to just be replying on your breaks and stuff, I appreciate it a lot, but also I get you've got stuff going on so honestly I don't want you to feel the need to reply as soon as you can. :+1::facepunch:

One big question I have, is After Effects used ever at DNEG or DNEGTV? Or if you know at other studios? Just because I know how to use After Effects really well but Nuke not so much, just yet, and to give me a reason to use Nuke I'm doing an assignment about node based and layer based workflows!
And don't worry I'm sure I'll think of plenty of silly questions over time for you :laughing: so sorry about that in advance :joy:
